text:
My go-to: "In an ideal world, how do you see content helping the business?" + "What impact do you expect the content to make, and how quickly?"

Gotta chase the threads from there, depending on how they answer.

Are they hiring because they're experimenting but haven't really bought into the value prop of content as an asset? Do they see it as the equivalent of advertising? Do they understand that it's a long-term play? What _type_ of content are they really looking for?

(This is the sort of questioning I ask internal teams when they come to us looking for help... figure it's the equivalent of getting hired, just internally versus coming into the org.)
